Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw two different habitats, one on land and one in water.
The student can illustrate a variety of living things in each habitat, including plants and animals.
The student can show and label specific examples of plants in each habitat, such as trees, grasses, and flowers.
The student can depict and label specific examples of animals in each habitat, such as squirrels in a land habitat or fish in a water habitat.
The student can observe patterns by comparing the different kinds of living things found in the land habitat versus the water habitat.
The student can organize and label their drawings clearly and neatly to display the diversity of life accurately.
